results.title: The Clown
results.creator_credit: Richard Balducci, Arthur Cohn and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Stories Without Words”.
A shaggy dog, Clown, lives in Paris with a street urchin: the two are inseparable. One day Clown runs off while the boy plays with friends. Using a painting of Clown, the boy desperately tries to find his dog. He has nearly given up when he at last sees clown and rushes to embrace it. Joy turns to despair as the boy realises the dog has attached itself to a blind man. The boy walks away.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Balducci, Arthur Cohn and Learning Corporation of America

results.title: The Thunderstorm
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Stories Without Words”.
Wordless story about a little boy who loses his dog during a summer storm. In the search for his pet, the boy discovers something of the interdependence of all living things in nature. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: The Merry-Go-Round horse
results.creator_credit: Richard Balducci and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Stories Without Words”.
A little ragamuffin adores a wooden merry-go-round horse. One day the horse is replaced by a merry-go-round “car” to be bought for a wealthy child who abuses his new toy. The little ragamuffin, conspires with friends to rescue the wonderful horse. They are successful and as the boy throws his arms around the horse’s neck he rides away.

results.title: The Magic balloons
results.creator_credit: Jacques Corbec and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Stories Without Words”.
A little boy sells balloons along the beach. In his fantasies the balloon takes on personalities. As the boy sleeps, a young couple walks off with his balloons, and when he wakes he goes in search of them. Most of the balloons have been burst, but he finally rescues one and together they escape. Designed to develop interpretation and expression in children of the significance of scenes and events. A film without words.

results.title: The Little airplane that grew
results.creator_credit: Pierre Rihouet and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Stories Without Words”.
A schoolboy daydreams in class. In his dream his model airlane becomes real and soars overhead performing breathtaking acrobatic feats.

group_works.title: The Snow queen
group_works.creator_credit: Vladlen Barbe, Mark Buchwald, Igor Kostigin, Joshua M. Greene, Lightyear Entertainment and Klassika Studio Moscow

results.title: The Snow queen
results.creator_credit: Vladlen Barbe, Mark Buchwald, Igor Kostigin, Joshua M. Greene, Lightyear Entertainment and Klassika Studio Moscow
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Stories to remember”.
Sigourney Weaver narrates Andersen’s moving story of a young girl’s quest for her young friend who has been captured by the beautiful but heartless Snow Queen and taken to her icy palace far from humankind. Along the way she makes new friends who help her in her search. Based on Susan Jeffers’ illustrations for the picture book adaptation by Amy Ehrlich.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Vladlen Barbe, Mark Buchwald, Igor Kostigin, Joshua M. Greene, Lightyear Entertainment and Klassika Studio Moscow

group_works.title: Little pig
group_works.creator_credit: Anna Home, Learning Corporation of America and BBC-TV

results.title: Little pig
results.creator_credit: Anna Home, Learning Corporation of America and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Stories Round the World”.
Upon her mother’s death a young Chinese girl is left alone to care for her infant brother. Against a background of the colourful city of Hong Kong, this film depicts their travels to reach an unknown aunt, only to discover that family struggling to make ends meet. In desperation the girl is driven to theft, but through the efforts of an understanding Confucian scribe she is saved from disgrace and learns a valuable lesson in human relations.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Anna Home, Learning Corporation of America and BBC-TV

group_siblings.title: I own the racecourse
group_siblings.creator_credit: Darrol Blake, Anna Home and Learning Corporation of America

results.title: I own the racecourse
results.creator_credit: Darrol Blake, Anna Home and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Stories Round the World”.
A heartwarming and humorous story from the novel by Patricia Wrightson. Set in Sydney, a backward child named Andy buys a racecourse for three dollars from a tramp.
